allow:
Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
docs: update commit_prep.md and .gitignore for git-agent workflow

CHANGES:

.gitignore:
- Added tracking for .claude/ directory and subdirectories
- Added tracking for agents/ directory and subdirectories
These new entries enable the git-agent workflow directories to be version controlled alongside other project directories.

commands/commit_prep.md:
- Refactored <CommitTitleHandling> section to use Task tool with subagent_type="git-agent" for commit title analysis
  * Replaced manual git status/diff review with delegated analysis to git-agent
  * Prompt now requests concise conventional commit titles under 72 characters
- Updated <CommitPrep> section to leverage git-agent for full commit message generation
  * Added TodoWrite and in_progress tracking at the start of the section
  * Replaced inline commit message creation with Task tool delegation to git-agent
  * Prompt now passes the established commit title to ensure consistency
  * Updated output format to reference "full commit message from git-agent"
  * Added mark todo as completed before final decision step
- Enhanced task tracking throughout with TodoWrite markers and in_progress state management

RATIONALE:

This refactoring implements a delegation pattern where commit preparation tasks are delegated to a specialized git-agent subagent. This improves workflow efficiency by:
1. Leveraging specialized git expertise for commit analysis and message generation
2. Maintaining consistent conventional commit formatting across the project
3. Reducing the burden on the main workflow orchestrator by distributing responsibilities
4. Enabling directories (.claude/ and agents/) that support the multi-agent workflow to be tracked in version control

RELATED:
Implements git-agent delegation pattern for commit workflow automation
EOF
)")
